stories.title: Robert Craft
stories.author: LoveCast
stories.description: When a broke assistant lands a job with New York's most powerful architect, she thinks she's climbed out of survival mode. But the higher the floor, the darker the secrets ‚Äî and Robert Craft doesn't hire without a reason.
stories.welcome_blurb:
You are about to be thrust into the shadowy world of Robert Craft, where power, seduction, and deadly secrets collide.

You will be confronted with a series of choices that will determine not just your survival, but who you can trust in a game where everyone has hidden motives.

Will you play it safe or risk everything for the truth? Will you choose loyalty or freedom?

intro.title: New Beginnings
paragraphs: The elevator doors opened to reveal the most impressive office you'd ever seen.
Floor-to-ceiling windows offered a breathtaking view of Manhattan, the city sprawling endlessly below like a glittering circuit board.
This was your chance to start over, to prove yourself.
The receptionist barely glanced up as you approached. 'Mr. Craft will see you now,' she said, her voice crisp and professional.
Your heart hammered as you walked toward the massive corner office, each step echoing in the marble-floored hallway.

confident_intro.title: Making an Impression
paragraphs: You stride forward with confidence, extending your hand toward the man behind the massive mahogany desk.
'Hello, Mr. Craft. I'm excited to be working with you.'
He looks up from his documents, steel-gray eyes assessing you with newfound interest.
Robert Craft is younger than you expected, maybe early thirties, with the kind of sharp features that belong on magazine covers rather than construction sites.
He sets down his pen and stands, towering over you as he accepts your handshake.
'Bold,' he says, his voice a low rumble. 'I like that. Most people are intimidated before they even walk through the door.'

patient_intro.title: Respectful Approach
paragraphs: You stand quietly near the door, hands clasped behind your back, waiting for acknowledgment.
The man behind the desk continues working for several long moments, the scratch of his pen the only sound in the vast office.
Finally, he looks up, steel-gray eyes meeting yours with an unreadable expression.
Robert Craft is younger than you expected, but there's something ancient in his gaze, like he's seen more than his years should allow.
'Patient,' he observes, leaning back in his chair. 'That's rarer than you might think in this city.'

observant_intro.title: Taking It All In
paragraphs: Your gaze drifts to the floor-to-ceiling windows, captivated by the sprawling cityscape below.
From this height, the people look like ants, the cars like toys. It's a god's-eye view of Manhattan.
'Impressive, isn't it?' a voice says behind you.
You turn to find Robert Craft approaching, his footsteps silent on the plush carpet.
He's younger than you expected, with sharp features and steel-gray eyes that seem to catalog every detail about you.
'The view changes you,' he continues, stopping beside you. 'Makes you realize how small most problems really are.'

chapter2.title: The Assignment
paragraphs: Robert gestures to the leather chair across from his desk. 'Sit. We need to discuss your role here.'
You settle into the chair, acutely aware of how he studies your every movement.
'Your predecessor left... unexpectedly,' he says, his tone carefully neutral. 'I need someone I can trust implicitly.'
There's something in his voice that makes your skin prickle with awareness.
'The work isn't just administrative. You'll be handling sensitive information, attending private meetings, making decisions that affect millions of dollars.'
He leans forward, his intense gaze never leaving yours.
'The question is: can I trust you with my secrets?'

choices.text: "That depends on what the secrets are"

chapter3_trust.title: Complete Commitment
paragraphs: Your answer seems to satisfy something in him. His shoulders relax slightly, though his eyes remain intense.
'Good,' he says, standing and moving to the window. 'Because once you're in, there's no going back.'
The weight of his words settles over you like a heavy cloak.
'I'll be honest with you,' he continues, not turning around. 'My business... it operates in gray areas. Nothing illegal, but not everything is black and white either.'
He turns back to face you, and there's something almost vulnerable in his expression.
'I need someone who won't run when things get complicated. Someone who can handle pressure... and keep their mouth shut.'

ending_committed.title: The Pact
paragraphs: Robert nods slowly, a ghost of a smile playing at his lips.
'Then welcome to Craft Enterprises,' he says, extending his hand.
When you shake it, his grip is firm, possessive almost.
'Your first task starts tomorrow. We're acquiring a company that doesn't want to be acquired. It's going to get... intense.'
As you stand to leave, he catches your wrist gently.
'One more thing,' he says, his voice dropping to barely above a whisper. 'In this business, trust is everything. Betray me, and you'll discover just how high these windows really are.'
The threat should terrify you. Instead, it sends a thrill through your veins.
You're in Robert Craft's world now. And there's no turning back.
